law.text: There is hereby created the advisory board called the "Miami-Dade Housing Civil Rights Oversight Board" (hereinafter "Oversight Board"). The purpose of the Oversight Board is to monitor the compliance with the Fair Housing Act and other housing-related civil rights laws, regulations, ordinances and the County's antidiscrimination policies by the Miami-Dade Public Housing Agency, the Department of Housing and Community Development, and other County departments which administer housing programs and to report on such compliance to the Board of County Commissioners annually.

The Oversight Board shall consist of ten (10) members as follows:
Four (4) members shall be appointed by the Board of County Commissioners.
One (1) representative of each of the following organizations:
Housing Opportunities Project for Excellence, Inc., and
Overall Tenant Advisory Council, Inc.
One (1) representative from the following County departments:
Miami-Dade Commission on Human Rights,
Miami-Dade Public Housing Agency,
The Miami-Dade Economic Advocacy Trust; and
The Department of Housing and Community Development.
law.catch_line: Sec. 2-2054. Terms, Reappointment, Vacancies and Attendance

text.section: All members shall serve two-year terms, except that the length of the terms of the initial appointees shall be adjusted to stagger the terms.

A member may be reappointed; however, a member may not serve more than four (4) consecutive terms. A member who has served four (4) consecutive terms is eligible to be appointed again after a two-year hiatus from the Oversight Board.

A member may be removed for failure to comply with the attendance requirements set out in Section 2-11.39 of the Code of Miami-Dade County, Florida as amended, or for any other reason as established in the Oversight Board Bylaws.

Bylaws. The Oversight Board shall make and adopt bylaws for its guidance, operation, governance and maintenance, provided such bylaws, and any amendments thereto, are consistent with federal and state laws and county ordinances, rules, regulations, policies and procedures and have been approved for form and legal sufficiency by the County Attorney's Office.

Officers. Immediately after the members are appointed, the members of the Oversight Board shall elect a chair, a vice chair and other officers as designated in the bylaws. Officers shall be elected for a two-year term.

Committees. The Oversight Board may establish through its bylaws such committees as it considers necessary to address the core mission of the Oversight Board. The bylaws shall also allow for the creation of ad hoc committees as necessary.

Meetings.
Meetings shall be conducted upon the call of the chairperson; however, the Oversight Board shall meet on a regular basis as determined in the bylaws during the County's fiscal year.
All Oversight Board meetings must be timely noticed at least seven (7) but not more than thirty (30) days prior to the meeting. Such notice shall be provided to the media and a copy shall be maintained at the Miami-Dade Commission on Human Rights. However, if immediate action is necessary to address a matter of imminent harm to public health, safety and welfare, the Oversight Board may schedule a meeting with no less than twenty-four (24) hours notice.
Minutes shall be kept of all meetings of the Oversight Board and such minutes shall be available for inspection by any interested person.
All meetings shall be open to the public.
Quorum. A quorum of the Oversight Board shall be one-half of the total number of members seated on the Oversight Board plus one.

Inquiries and Communications. All inquiries or communications from the Oversight Board or any of its members to the Miami-Dade Commission on Human Rights or to the County shall be made through the Chair of the Oversight Board, Informal communications may be made freely from the Miami-Dade Commission on Human Rights to the Oversight Board members, in a manner that is consistent with the Sunshine Law.
Orientation. All new members of the Oversight Board shall receive sufficient training and orientation to enable them to perform their duties.

law.catch_line: Sec. 2-2057. Applicability of Federal, State and County Laws
law.text: The Oversight Board shall be subject to and governed by: Chapter 286 of Florida Statutes, ("Sunshine Law"); Chapter 119 of Florida Statutes ("Public Records Act"); Chapter 112, Part III of Florida Statutes ("Code of Ethics for Public Officers and Employees"); Section 2-11.1 of Miami-Dade County Code ("Conflict of Interest and Code of Ethics Ordinance"); Article IB of Miami-Dade County Code ("Standards for Creation and Review of Boards Generally") and the Home Rule Charter.
The County Manager's Office shall designate appropriate staff to support the Oversight Board.
The County Attorney's Office shall provide legal counsel, as needed, to the Oversight Board.
